meanings.definition: Eyeglasses with lenses that have two sections for correcting both close and distant vision.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa wears bifocals to see things up close and far away.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of bifocals to help her read and drive.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that wearing bifocals made him feel like a detective with special glasses.
meanings.sent4: Her bifocals were like magic windows, bringing both the words on the page and the distant mountains into focus.
meanings.sent5: With bifocals, the world became clear in all its details, from the tiny ants on the ground to the birds in the sky.

meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with lenses that have two different focal lengths.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used bifocals to study tiny insects and distant stars.
meanings.sent2: He found it convenient to switch between the two focal lengths of his bifocals.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a funny picture of a squirrel wearing bifocals to see nuts up close and trees far away.
meanings.sent4: Her bifocals were like having two lenses into different worlds, one for reading and one for exploring.
meanings.sent5: Through his bifocals, he saw the world in a new way, with details he had never noticed before.
